utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay, I’m confused. Which one is Mr. Robot?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’ll give you a hint. We’re watching Daredevil.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Will you two please inform Amy how much you enjoy adhering to a strict bathroom schedule?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Can’t.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Won’t.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Didn’t.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I told you, you can’t regulate every aspect of our lives.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I can if you’d just roll over and accept your fate.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I’m sorry for bringing this over here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Believe me, we know what you’re going through.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And I think the most helpful thing we can tell you is no backsies.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Mm-hmm.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Sheldon, I understand that you like things a certain way and I’m willing to make some concessions, but you have to be open to compromise.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: She’s right. That’s reasonable.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Oh, look who’s in favour of compromise, the woman who married Leonard Hofstadter.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, she didn’t compromise. She settled. There’s a difference.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah. You tell him, babe.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: What time do you and Bernadette head out?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: As soon as I get home. We’re hoping to make it before dark.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’ve never been to Palm Springs.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, you should go. It’s terrific. I really thrive anywhere the women and the temperature are over 90.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I don’t know. If I want to watch old people sweat, I can just FaceTime my family in India.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: It’s nice you and Bernadette are getting away.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, she wants us to spend more time together before the baby comes.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: So then what are you doing here buying comic books?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, he wants us to spend more time together before the baby comes.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: When you live with someone, there’s gonna be conflict. You just have to keep communicating.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well I’m open to that.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Okay. Well, for starters, there’s nothing wrong with keeping our toothbrushes in the same holder.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Sheldon, what do you say to that?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I think we should see other people.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, as a male, I have an evolutionary drive to perpetuate my DNA. Restricting myself to a single partner is against my nature.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: We sleep together once a year. You want other partners?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Don’t blame me. Blame your pal, biology. He’s the pervert pulling the strings here.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You wanna see other people? Go see other people.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: I hope one of those people is a monkey, ’cause this is bananas.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Hey, you can make jokes, but if this keeps up, he’s gonna move back in here.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right. Well, let’s just get them apart for a while so they can cool down.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Good. Then before we reintroduce them, we’ll give him one of her sweaters so he can get used to her scent again.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: So it’s okay for you to joke around?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, that’s actually what we did with him when Howard came back from space.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Honey, how ya feeling? The book says at this stage of the pregnancy morning sickness should be going away. So that’s good news, right?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette (pff)
utterance.content: The only thing I hate more than you right now is that book.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: There she is. Who’s ready for a hot, three-hour car ride to the desert?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Next vomit is gonna be in your lap.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: I’m sorry. We don’t have to go.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: But it’s our last chance to take a vacation that’s just the two of us.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: How ’bout we stay here? We don’t even have to tell anyone. It’ll be like a secret vacation at home.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Keeping secrets from our friends, it does sound kinda fun.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Does it sound sexy?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You just heard me throwing up.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You bet I did.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You’re so weird.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know what’s weird? How turned on you are right now.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You know, people are quick to accuse me of being difficult to live with, but the truth is, Amy is just as challenging.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Just as challenging?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: As you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Just as challenging as you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: When we’re sleeping, she breathes on me. One night, it got so bad I almost grabbed Toto

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Leonard breathes on me, too. It’s not a big deal.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: She’s always complaining about people at work.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, so does Leonard. It’s kind of annoying, but it’s not the end of the world.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Do you know that when I get out of the shower, she eyes me up and down like I’m a piece of meat?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, so does Leonard. Can’t I just get ready in the morning without him giving me his goofy thumbs-up? Hey-hey-hey.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know. Sometimes I would just like to be appreciated for my mind.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Agreed. Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That feels great.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, pulling a quarter out of your ear isn’t the only magic these hands can do. In fact, what’s this between your toes?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Can you please stop making money come out of me for two minutes? Was that the front door?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It sounded like it. Oh, my God. Someone’s in the house.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Lock the door, lock the door.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: We should call the police.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Uh, I left my phone downstairs.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Damn, so did I.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Wait, I have my iPad.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: What are we gonna do, e-mail 911?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: That’s not helpful.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You know I rely on humour in times of stress.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Let me know when you start, because that wasn’t funny.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Is that the hot tub?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Who would use our hot tub?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, the answer is both more and less disturbing than you think.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Who is it?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Stuart. He heard me talking about us going away. I guess he decided to invite himself over?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Should we say something to him?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Maybe. How ’bout, hey, you look like a boiled chicken breast?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I meant like, what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Nah, that’s not gonna hurt his feelings.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Why is nothing easy with him?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look, here’s the thing you need to understand about Sheldon. He’s the worst.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I prefer to think of it as high-maintenance.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I prefer to think of myself as five-ten, but I still need to get all my pants hemmed.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I guess I should have known what I was getting myself into.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Don’t beat yourself up. You’ve never lived with anyone before.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That’s true.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And you’re starting out with Sheldon Cooper. That’s like getting your first pet and having it be, I don’t know, what’s a kind of pet that ruins your life?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You’re not making me feel better.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Look, even when Penny and I started living together, there was a learning curve. But I promise you, it does get easier.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: He put a sign up in the bathroom that says, number of days without Amy’s hair on the soap.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Yeah. My record was six.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Is it me, or is there something fun about watching him just float there?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Maybe this is why people get fish tanks. Who just turned the porch lights on?

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Is someone else here?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Hmm. They must have left the tub on. Good thing I stopped by. Ah. Aaaaah! What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: What are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Maybe Howard and Bernadette said I could be here.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Did they?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Answer the question, what are you doing here?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I had nothing else to do tonight. The last couple of months, I come here when I know they’re not home.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: They heard me in the bushes once, but they thought I was a raccoon.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: I told you raccoons don’t say uh-oh.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You know, one night, Leonard’s nose whistled so loud, I swear it was like sleeping on a train track.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Have you noticed it’s always an A-flat?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Is it? Oh. It’s like his sinuses are right here in the car.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: If we’re just going to drive around aimlessly, the least you could do is take me for ice cream.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Yeah, I’ll take you for ice cream.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, see, why can’t Amy be that subservient? She has coitus one time, suddenly she’s Gloria Steinem. Anyway, I suppose an ice cream parlour will be a good place to meet other women.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, please, you’re barely interested in a physical relationship with one person. Why would you want to confuse and disappoint others?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Being with Amy has awoken the sexual creature within. When I see a pretty gal walking down the street, I think, hubba hubba, like any other guy.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You kiss your mother with that mouth? ‘Cause it’s fine.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Here you go.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Shall we toast?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: To Howard and Bernadette, and the house key they never asked me to return.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: You said you got it back.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Well, clearly, I lied.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So how’s your apartment?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Not great. The electricity’s out.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: So why don’t you get it fixed?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I called, and they’re like, pay your bill.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: If you ever need somewhere to crash, there’s always my place.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, no. I don’t want to be an inconvenience. You’ve got all your lady friends, and…

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Actually, I’m single now.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: What? When did that happen?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: It’s okay. It’s by choice. Well, their choice, and it’s not okay.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh. Sorry. I didn’t know.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Nobody does. I was embarrassed so I didn’t say anything.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Why wouldn’t he tell us? Are we bad friends?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: He’s in our hot tub drinking our wine.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: Yeah, he deserves to be alone.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: So you’re back out on the dating scene now?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah, yeah, a little.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Oh, that must be fun. How’s that going?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I’m in a hot tub with you, so pretty bad.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Maybe I should just give in to his stupid bathroom schedule.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: No, don’t do that.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: But you did.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Exactly. Learn from my mistakes. No matter where I am at 7:18am, there better be a toilet nearby.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s just so much easier to give him what he wants.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh, true, but think of how much you’ve accomplished. Who got him to stop Purelling his pocket change?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Me.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And who got him to put things other than gloves in the glove compartment?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Me. It was mittens.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: And who got him to try a turkey dog?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: That was actually Koothrappali, but I did let him spit it out in my hand.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How can you stop now? That’s like walking out of Pinocchio right before he becomes a real boy.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: You know, you’re right. I’m in this relationship, too. I need to stand up for myself.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Of course you do.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: And if he doesn’t like it, he can move back here.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Oh. He can try. He’d just need a good locksmith.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, who you gonna hit on? The girl in front of us got strawberry. That’s your favourite.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: No. No, if we both like it, I’ll spend the rest of my life opening the freezer and going, aw, no strawberry.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: What about the girl behind the counter?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hmm? Well, she spends her whole day scooping. One arm’s probably bigger than the other.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Is it possible you might not actually want to meet someone?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: You are truly wise.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Thank you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’d say wise beyond your years, but you’re getting up there.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right. Come on. What is really going on with you?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Penny, I am going to tell you a story that I’ve never told anyone.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: All right.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I was 13 years old, and on spring break from college.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Not relating. Go on.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I came home early because they ran out of math to teach me.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, now I’m with ya. Okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: My mother was at bible study. I walked in the house expecting to find it empty, and I heard a sound coming from my parents’ bedroom. When I opened the door, I saw my father having relations with another woman.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Oh, that’s awful.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I know. It’s also why I never open a door without knocking three times. I mean, the first

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Well, what happened with your dad?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: We locked eyes, I ran to my room, and we never, ever spoke of it.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: You poor thing.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Since Amy and I have been living together, we’ve been bickering like my parents used to.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: And you’re afraid you’re gonna do something like your dad did?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Yes. I need to prepare her now to save her from pain down the road.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Down the road? Sheldon, she wanted to share a toothbrush holder with you, and now you’re at an ice cream parlour trying to pick up women.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Well, anything can sound silly when you put it in that tone.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Honey, instead of worrying about pain you might cause in the future, how about trying to fix the pain you’re causing her right now?

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I’m sure you’re right. I suppose I should apologize to you, as well.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: That must have hurt watching me look for other women without ever even considering you. Please understand that I think of you as more of a nanny.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Just finish your ice cream so I can get you home to bed.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: I wonder if this is what it feels like to be Bernadette’s baby.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I don’t know. Bernadette’s baby doesn’t have a Jacuzzi jet hitting just the right spot.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: Those jets are for my secret spot, not his.

utterance.speaker: Bernadette
utterance.content: What do you do in there?

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: It’s called relaxing, and that’s all you need to know.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Well, it’s getting late. Maybe we should head home.

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Yeah, you’re probably right.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: You coming?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Yeah, just give me a minute.

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Why?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: Well, you know how you’re wearing a bathing suit?

utterance.speaker: Raj
utterance.content: Yeah?

utterance.speaker: Stuart
utterance.content: I kind of went the other way.

utterance.speaker: Howard
utterance.content: You jackasses just bought yourselves a hot tub!

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: What do you think?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: It’s a nice enough spot. You know, if I’m going to start standing up for myself, this is exactly the kind of thing…

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We’re back.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh, hi. Hi.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Hello.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: How you guys doing?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: We’re doing good. I think Sheldon has something he would like to say to Amy.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: I wanted to apologize for my behaviour today. It, it was unnecessary. This is warm. Oh, and also, I am willing to forego the bathroom schedule.

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: Oh. Really?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Why does she get that? We never got that.

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Do you want him back?

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: I’m very happy for you.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy, you should know I was never really interested in seeing other women. And to prove how serious I am about us, I’m willing to take our relationship to the next level.

utterance.speaker: Sheldon
utterance.content: Amy Farrah Fowler, will you share this toothbrush holder with me?

utterance.speaker: Amy
utterance.content: I would love to.

utterance.speaker: Leonard
utterance.content: Did we really need to be here for this?

utterance.speaker: Penny
utterance.content: Call me crazy, but I found it moving.
